page.title: 08FARMING AROUND CLYRO
page.content: The silage and hay are used for winter animal feed. The hay is stored in two barns and the silage stored in a large silage pit. Most of the buildings are{old {stone structures with a few new steel {and zinc barns}built nearby. There are{three tractors, a {baler, a sprayer and spreader and a {J.C.B.}The winter corn is combined during early Autumn using a hired {Combine Harvester. The sheep and cattle are sold at the market at Hay-on-Wye. The busiest times of the year are at{lambing time,}March,{shearing, June, and during{hay making,}late June or early July.
